notes: Norfolk City has 5 wards with ward representatives. Endpoint verified via direct query.
City of Richmond has 9 council districts. Endpoint hosted on COR ArcGIS services.
Baltimore City has 14 council districts. ALREADY IN REGISTRY but endpoint verified. Boundaries finalized November 2023.
DC has 8 wards from 2022 redistricting. ALREADY IN REGISTRY but endpoint verified. Includes Census 2020 demographic data.
Virginia Beach has 10 council voter districts. ALREADY IN REGISTRY, endpoint verified. Court-imposed districts.
Annapolis has 8 wards with elected aldermen/alderwomen. Portal found with Ward Map Lookup app, but REST endpoint not yet extracted. Ward boundaries updated for 2025 election.
nextSteps: Extract REST API endpoint from ArcGIS Hub

notes: Frederick has 5 geographic council districts + 2 at-large members (7 total). New boundaries approved Feb 2025. County GIS portal found (gis2-fcgmd.opendata.arcgis.com) but need city-specific endpoint.
Hampton has 6 council districts + mayor. Uses council-manager government. GIS page found but REST endpoint not yet located.
nextSteps: Search Hampton GIS services for council districts endpoint

notes: Newport News has city council and school board districts (reference to district maps found). GeoHub portal exists at geohub.nnva.gov with council district map reference. ArcGIS REST directory at maps.nnva.gov/gis/rest/services but specific endpoint not found yet.
nextSteps: Query Newport News REST services directory for council district layer

notes: Chesapeake has open data portal but no council district/ward data found in initial search. Need to determine if city uses district-based or at-large system.
nextSteps: Research Chesapeake council structure, search portal for ward/district data

notes: Portsmouth has historical references to 'Four Original Wards' from early 1900s. Current structure unclear - may be at-large. Need clarification on current ward/district system.
nextSteps: Research current Portsmouth council election structure

notes: Gaithersburg has Zone Lookup app for 'Council Districts' found, but unclear if these are geographic voting districts or just administrative zones. Mayor + City Council structure. Need to verify if district-based or at-large.

Alexandria uses at-large council system with 6 councilmembers + mayor elected city-wide. No geographic districts. Historical ward system was replaced in 1922. NOT APPLICABLE for district-based registry.

Rockville uses at-large council system with 6 councilmembers + mayor elected city-wide. Council expanded from 4 to 6 members in 2023. No geographic districts. NOT APPLICABLE for district-based registry.

Roanoke City uses at-large council system with 6 councilmembers + mayor. Largest city in Virginia without ward system. Roanoke County (separate jurisdiction) has 5 magisterial districts. NOT APPLICABLE for district-based registry.

name: Maryland iMAP
notes: Maryland's statewide GIS data catalog. Contains municipal boundaries and some local government data. Free public access per Senate Bill 94 (2015).

name: Virginia Geographic Information Network (VGIN)
notes: Virginia's statewide GIS clearinghouse. Contains administrative boundaries for 96 counties, 40 cities, and 118 towns. 2024 annual download available.

name: Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online (HRGEO)
notes: Regional GIS portal for Hampton Roads area including Norfolk, Virginia Beach, Hampton, Newport News, Portsmouth, Chesapeake. Provides regional parcel data and other datasets.

name: Baltimore Metropolitan Council GIS
notes: Regional GIS data center for Baltimore metropolitan area. Provides data and cartographic products for member jurisdictions.

alreadyInRegistry: Baltimore MD, Washington DC, Virginia Beach VA
notes: Mid-Atlantic discovery focused on MD, VA, DC municipalities. Two new verified endpoints found (Norfolk, Richmond). Several promising leads require follow-up investigation. Three cities confirmed as at-large systems (not applicable). Regional GIS hubs identified for future batch discovery.
